text_image_relationship.layout_style: Single column of text below a horizontal rectangular miniature with a red rubric above; the miniature spans the text width and is followed by a historiated initial at the beginning of the next text block; no text wraps around the image.

text_content.script_style: Main text in Gothic textura quadrata, rubric in red executed in Gothic cursiva with decorative flourishes

color_scheme.color_usage: Gold leaf serves as background to denote the heavenly or supernatural realm; blue and green pigments enliven foliage; red is reserved for rubrics and initial; layered application with white highlights creates volume; pigments remain well-preserved with minimal degradation.

features: Larger angelic figures positioned above a smaller kneeling beast
Linear left-to-right arrangement emphasizing narrative progression
Stylized trees flank composition to frame the scene
Ground line unites figures against gold background
Horizontal emphasis reinforced by rectangular frame

decorative_elements: Rectangular frame with blue bars and white hatch decoration
Red and white jeweled border motif along top and bottom
Historiated initial 'E' in blue and gold marking the following text

drawing_technique.line_style: Bold brown-ink outlines with finer internal penwork defining drapery and hair
drawing_technique.shading_method: Flat fields of color with minimal hatching, accented by white highlights on robes
drawing_technique.perspective_handling: Hierarchical scaling without linear perspective; depth implied by overlapping and vertical placement

content_theme.scene_description: The miniature illustrates Revelation 13:11, depicting three figures against a burnished gold ground. Two haloed angels stand to the left and center, clad in long ivory tunics with simple belting, their right hands raised in proclamation. Their hair is rendered in tight ringlets, and halos are outlined in blue. To the right, the apocalyptic beast kneels on bent knees, its anthropomorphic body draped in a brown robe, head grotesquely bestial with an open maw exhaling flame. All figures rest on a single ground line. Stylized trees at the far left and right act as natural framing devices. Below the scene, a large historiated initial 'E' in blue and gold introduces the following text. Decorative features include blue bars with white hatchwork surrounds and a red and white jeweled border strip. Symbolically, the gold background indicates the supernatural setting, halos denote sanctity, and the beast’s flame suggests diabolical speech. The composition draws the eye from the announcing angels to the subservient beast, emphasizing hierarchical importance. Visually, the image integrates with the text by separating the red rubric above from the main Latin script below, guiding the reader from verse to illumination and onward into the narrative.

technical_features.material: Premium calf vellum with uniform thickness and smooth parchment surface; faint hair-follicle pattern visible under magnification.
technical_features.preservation_condition: Pigments remain vivid with minimal oxidation; slight flaking of green pigment at edges; gold leaf stable with minor abrasion; folio shows minimal cockling.
notable_physical_characteristics: Visible brown-ink underdrawing under UV light
Fine brush strokes apparent in layered pigment application

functional_analysis.intended_audience: Individual lay patron engaged in personal reading of Revelation

analysis.scholarly_interpretation: Created in a mid-13th-century French workshop, this miniature exemplifies the era’s fascination with apocalyptic themes and the growing demand for personalized devotional books. The use of burnished gold leaf as a background situates the scene in an otherworldly realm, while the elegant Gothic textura script and rubricated glosses reflect professional scribal practices in urban scriptoria. The hierarchical scaling—prominent angels above a diminutive, kneeling beast—reinforces the theological message of divine authority over infernal forces. Technically, the work shows a sophisticated multi-layered pigment application, underdrawn in brown ink and elevated by white highlights, indicating collaboration between a master illuminator and specialist colorists. Iconographically, the beast’s flame-breathing maw directly visualizes the text’s reference to the second beast of Revelation, linking word and image without the need for captioning. Comparatively, its palette and figural types resonate with contemporaneous manuscripts from the Parisian circle, suggesting shared models and workshop exchange. The miniature thus occupies a nexus of tradition and innovation: it adheres to established apocalyptic iconography while employing refined compositional techniques and luxurious materials to satisfy the devotional and status-displaying ambitions of a learned lay patron.
